Issues.Title: fix(compiler): unable to resolve destructuring variable declarations
Issues.Body:
Currently the partial evaluator isn't able to resolve a variable declaration that uses destructuring in the form of `const {value} = {value: 0}; const foo = value;`. These changes add some logic to allow for us to resolve the variable's value.

Fixes #36917.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler): unable to resolve destructuring variable declarations" (#37497)

Issues.Title: "Get References" in the Angular LS
Issues.Body:
# "get references" in the Angular Language Service

The language service recently re-opened discussion on https://github.com/angular/vscode-ng-language-service/issues/29, which is the oldest issue in the VSCode extension repo at nearly 4 years old. Originally, the language service was planning to add support for "get references" post the Ivy migration. However, due to a lack of engineering resources available to commit to this migration and a resurgence of community interest in this feature, we have recently landed support for TS references from Angular templates (#37437).

I think we should _try_ to make this feature more powerful, since template->TS references are maybe 10% of use cases (before the mentioned commit, this was already doable by getting a definition and searching for TS references). At the same time, we don't want to invest too much time in our solutions, as it will eventually get scrapped (even if that "eventually" has no deadline). So, I suggest we constrain solutions for "get references" as

- Relatively simple, even if this leads to a less-performant solution. Today's language service already has some very large performance bottlenecks; its unlikely that a very performant "get references" will overcome the tail-end costs of parsing, analyzing modules, etc.

- Focused first on the 90% use cases

Okay, so in some order of priority combined from the two ideas above, here are my suggestions for how we _might_ be able to implement "get references":

## Case 1: Ng->TS references

This is already done by #37437. The idea is trivial - we get the TS definition for an Ng symbol and then defer searching for other TS symbols using a TS language service.

## Case 2: TS->Ng references

### Case 2.1: Component members

This is also straightforward. As Ng symbols, component members can only be used in the template that belongs to the component. So we just walk the Ast and record everytime we hit a usage of the symbol.

There is a bit smarter way to do this that also gives us for free information about whether the reference is in a string (a reference entry can be augmented with this information): first we grep the template for occurences of the symbol, and then descend into only the relevant Ast branches to validate the symbol. If the symbol is not a valid reference, then it's a reference in a string.

### Case 2.x: Directive members->template, Directive/Component selectors->template, ...

Here is where it gets tricky. Okay, so first we need to find all NgModules a directive/component is in; this is solved when we analyze NgModules.

Next we need to find all the templates the directive/component is being used in. We don't know we've found a usage until we parse a template, so we need to construct a set of template files to search. This can be done in two levels:

1. Include only files of NgModules that import the relevant directive

2. Use the same grep trick as in 2.1 to prune files that definitely don't have a usage

After this we parse each file and walk it to find references of the Angular item.

Needs feedback:

- Can we be smarter about the searching?
- Grepping can time-consuming and can start falling into the "very complicated" category. For example, matching a selector like `form[a][b].a.b` requires matching 16 different combinations. Here a heuristic could be put in place.

* Note: this section also applies to inputs, outputs, pipes, etc. For inputs/outputs we first find references to the enclosing directive and then search for the input/output. Pipes are imported just like directives and their "selector" is the pipe name.

### Case 3: Ng->Ng references

This only applies to references, and is localized to exactly one Ng template file. Thus the implementation can be identical to Case 2.1

Requesting review: @kyliau
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ""Get References" in the Angular LS" (#37496)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): Improve signature selection by finding exact match
Issues.Body:
The function signature selection algorithm is totally naive. It'd
unconditionally pick the first signature if there are multiple
overloads. This commit improves the algorithm by returning an exact
match if one exists.

Issues.Title: refactor(forms): unification of template-driven validator logic
Issues.Body:
Currently the template-driven validators logic is a bit inconsistent where some validators use `@Input` getters/setters when in other cases we use `ngOnChanges` lifecycle hook to achieve the same behavior (see [packages/forms/src/directives/validators.ts](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/030eff2b81fdf3750a6604415dbdffcb43f8d159/packages/forms/src/directives/validators.ts)). We should explore if we can unify this logic (most likely using `ngOnChanges` to always have a consistent behavior between Ivy/VE, based on https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/35330#issuecomment-638859443).

We should also check whether we can unify these conditions too (they seem very similar, but vary in minor details):
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/030eff2b81fdf3750a6604415dbdffcb43f8d159/packages/forms/src/directives/validators.ts#L174
and 
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/030eff2b81fdf3750a6604415dbdffcb43f8d159/packages/forms/src/directives/validators.ts#L284

[note: this is a low priority item atm and will probably be a breaking change]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "refactor(forms): unification of template-driven validator logic" (#37493)

Issues.Title: test(language-service): Remove all markers from test project
Issues.Body:
This commit removes all markers from the inline template in
`AppComponent` and external template in `TemplateReference`.

Test scenarios should be colocated with the test cases themselves.
Besides, many existing cases are not setup correctly.
For example, if we want to test autocomplete for HTML element, the existing test case is like:
```
<~{cursor} h1>
```
This doesn't make much sense, because the language service already sees
the `h1` tag in the template. The more representative test case should be:
```
<~{cursor
```
IMO, this reflects the real-world use case better.

This commit also uncovers a bug in the way HTML entities autocompletion
is done. There's an off-by-one error in which a cursor that is placed immediately after the ampersand character fails to trigger autocomplete.

Issues.Title: i18n-placeholder to placeholders assigned by variables
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
 This feature request is for @angular/localize


### Description
When you have a placeholder that's assigned by a variable, the translation doesn't work even if you use the `$localize`String`` on the variable at typescript and also use the i18n-placeholder on input. 

I have the following case here as example: 

``` 
<fieldset>
        <label [for]="const.key" i18n>{{ const.label }}</label>
        <input
          [type]="const.type"
          [placeholder]="const.label"
          [formControlName]="const.key"
          [id]="const.key"
          *ngIf="const.type === 'text' || const.type === 'number'"
          [attr.disabled]="!allowEdit ? '' : null"
          i18n-placeholder
        />
</fieldset>
``` 

```
{
 key: 'supplementaryInformation',
 label: $localize`Supplementary Information`,
 type: 'text',
 ignore: false,
}
```

And when the application is rendered it doesn't work. 
![Capturar](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20867062/84033516-57ef8380-a96f-11ea-8076-3884d8f22289.PNG)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "i18n-placeholder to placeholders assigned by variables" (#37485)

Issues.Title: Angular 9 - ngOnDestroy called on not OnDestroy instance when in multi provision
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package probably `core`, 9.1.9 ### Is this a regression? since 8 - yes, since 9.0 - maybe. Connected issue - https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/35231 As least I just migrated from 8.2.14 ### Description So, as in mentioned ticket 35231 the problem occurs when `ngOnDestroy` is called. Recently the context was changed, now it seems to be called on every instance in `multi` provision. Even when some of them does not implement `OnDestroy` (at least it looks so, but as you later will see - it does not fit to logic, context is changed again). Screenshot from chrome debugger when destroy was called (file `core.js`). ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17334466/83994077-a859e780-a955-11ea-8396-ba6ee6137626.png) The problem is - `RouteResultExternalLinksManager` does not implement `OnDestroy`, and because of that exception occurs: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17334466/83994245-13a3b980-a956-11ea-97cb-5fe8ee8f5781.png) I would even say that `RouteResultExternalLinksManager` is not an instance of `Subscriber` as it looks like in debugger: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17334466/83994288-36ce6900-a956-11ea-8bd7-a192da8548a2.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17334466/83994304-3df57700-a956-11ea-9816-acae3bfa1000.png) ## üî• Exception or Error 

TypeError: this.clearSubscriptions is not a function
    at RouteResultExternalLinksManager.push.../../libs/imap/shared/flow-utils/subscriber.ts.Subscriber.ngOnDestroy (subscriber.ts:9)
    at executeOnDestroys (core.js:9522)
    at cleanUpView (core.js:9448)
    at destroyViewTree (core.js:9248)
    at destroyLView (core.js:9401)
    at RootViewRef.push.../../node_modules/@angular/core/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm5/core.js.ViewRef.destroy (core.js:10143)
    at ComponentRef.push.../../node_modules/@angular/core/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm5/core.js.ComponentRef.destroy (core.js:23229)
    at RouterOutlet.push.../../node_modules/@angular/router/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm5/router.js.RouterOutlet.deactivate (router.js:5355)
    at ActivateRoutes.push.../../node_modules/@angular/router/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm5/router.js.ActivateRoutes.deactivateRouteAndOutlet (router.js:2328)
    at ActivateRoutes.push.../../node_modules/@angular/router/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm5/router.js.ActivateRoutes.deactivateRouteAndItsChildren (router.js:2308)

Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: [BUG]: Angular 9 Ivy not working with decorators where usage Proxy class
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler

### Is this a regression?

Yes, Angular 8 - good work with Proxy class (with VE)

Also, if I set in tsconfig.json

```
  "angularCompilerOptions": {
    "enableIvy": false,
   }
```

It will work

### Description

https://github.com/ngxs-labs/data/blob/master/lib/decorators/src/persistence/persistence.ts

I use a proxy class in the decorator, so inheritance works correctly for CommonJS, ES5, ES2016+

```ts
 return new Proxy(stateClass, {
            construct(clazz: DataStateClass, args: Any[]): StateClass {
                const stateInstance: StateClass = Reflect.construct(clazz, args);
                const providers: PersistenceProvider[] = ensureProviders(repositoryMeta, stateInstance, options);
                registerStorageProviders(providers);
                return stateInstance;
            }
        });
```


I tried instead Proxy class
https://stackoverflow.com/a/54526221/8029169

But not working with Angular 8 (for stackblitz CommonJS) and Angular 9 by comment: 

```
Tried this and it works fine unless you're in Angular :( In such a case the constructor args are assumed to be dependencies and so always undefined (even if some args are indeed provided) if this is not an Injectable() class
```

Maybe I need use other class reference instead target from decorator?

If you look at when the factory is called

```ts
   return new Proxy(stateClass, {
          get(target, prop, receiver) {

            if (prop === '…µfac') {
              console.log('target', '…µfac', prop, Reflect.get(...arguments))
             }

            return Reflect.get(...arguments);
          },
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12021443/83969019-e31c3b00-a8d5-11ea-9c77-e900cdc4aeca.png)


Then I need to intercept precisely this moment of the call and after calling it, execute the corresponding code.

However `construct (clazz, args) {}` is not called.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

https://github.com/ishanuda/ngxs-data-issue-mr-1

```ts
$ yarn install
$ yarn start --open 4200
```

open file `./node_modules/@ngxs-labs/data/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015/ngxs-labs-data-decorators.js`

I use a proxy class in one place

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12021443/83966480-1d301180-a8c3-11ea-873a-0340dfc69a78.png)

And after reload page we don't see `console.log('Hell World')` only work `console.log('stateClass', stateClass)`. But if we downgrade to Angular 8, it's work. Why?

Angular 9 doen't invoke real constructor? Therefore, the construct method of the proxy class is not called? How can I solve this problem, since the @ngxs-labs/data package is used in many of my projects and it‚Äôs difficult now to switch to Angular 9?

## üî• Exception or Error

If the proxy class would work, then the logic would work.  But nothing happens

Angular 9.1.9

Issues.Title: Library decorator metadata ReferenceError with SSR
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package I suspect `@angular/compiler-cli`. But it might also affect `@angular/compiler`, `ng-packagr` or `@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr`. ### Is this a regression? Yes, I cannot reproduce the same behavior with a clean workspace created with `@angular/cli` version 8.0.2 ### Description There is an open issue #30586 and a related PR #37382 that describe the error I am facing very well. However, if I am reading those descriptions correctly, that issue should not occur when using the CLI or `ng-packagr`. Please see https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30586#issue-446511402: > Everything currently works as expected within the CLI [...] and https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30586#issuecomment-591336925: > In the current state, where libraries still publish in View Engine, the CLI, ng-packagr, and angular/components have custom tooling that fix this issue [...] In my case the error does happen with a published View Engine library and SSR, so I wanted to make you aware that there might be an additional issue. This could also be already fixed in an upcoming patch (see https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/37382#issuecomment-637854045), if I am not reading too much into the part about re-enabling tsickle. As mentioned in the linked issue https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30586#issuecomment-494898597, this only happens when `emitDecoratorMetadata` is enabled. Also, when building the library the compiler throws an error with `strictMetadataEmit` enabled. With the current library schematic you have to change both defaults to reproduce the runtime error. The mentioned defaults are in place since https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/6b28d3ac51f226f6f7fc6065de9d5f2db72302d1 for `emitDecoratorMetadata` and at least since https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/44086c60ff1d6c26d30850bef125120f6c498ac1#diff-5c9bd7887460d6be81e59d58f93ec849 for `strictMetadataEmit`. I don't know how common the use cases for enabling `emitDecoratorMetadata` in the current state are or how many older libraries just never changed this option, so I am not sure how common this issue is. I got here via https://github.com/manfredsteyer/angular-oauth2-oidc/issues/773, but I don't know of other popular libraries having the same problem. If documentation of the issue makes more sense than supporting this in version 9, I am happy to provide a PR for the docs. Please feel free to close this issue, if I am only telling you things you already know :slightly_smiling_face: ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction See [Repo](https://github.com/JohannesHuster/decorator-metadata-error). I have added the dist folder, in case you don't even need to pull the repo that way. - `ng build my-lib --prod` - `ng run my-app:serve-ssr` (Same behavior with `-c production`) #### Reproduction of the repo above - `ng new my-workspace` - `ng g library my-lib` - `ng g application my-app` - `ng add @nguniversal/express-engine --clientProject my-app` - Apply something like https://github.com/JohannesHuster/decorator-metadata-error/commit/713fc1e46225cbb4b74759a6308e40c9f25ad43a - Apply https://github.com/JohannesHuster/decorator-metadata-error/commit/3d6ad423d66476aa0b4233bc2b7b7a1147d0ebd9 ## üî• Exception or Error 

.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:140435
    Object(tslib__WEBPACK_IMPORTED_MODULE_0__["__metadata"])("design:paramtypes", [Document])
                                                                                   ^

ReferenceError: Document is not defined
    at Module.../../node_modules/my-lib-published/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm2015/my-lib.js (.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:140435:84)
    at __webpack_require__ (.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:20:30)
    at Object../src/app/app.component.ts (.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:161543:12)
    at __webpack_require__ (.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:20:30)
    at Object../src/app/app.module.ts (.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:161909:25)
    at __webpack_require__ (.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:20:30)
    at Object../src/app/app.server.module.ts (.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:161949:22)
    at __webpack_require__ (.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:20:30)
    at Object../src/main.server.ts (.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:162019:27)
    at __webpack_require__ (.../dist/my-app/server/main.js:20:30)

A server error has occurred.
node exited with 1 code.

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/router



### Description


`Route.pathMatch` field is now typed as `string | undefined` but actually it can accept `prefix` or `full` as a valid value.
I want to restrict invalid values statically at compilation step with a string literal types.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Typing `pathMatch` as `pathMatch?: 'prefix' | 'full'`

### Describe alternatives you've considered

This is a breaking change because it may cause build error by narrowing the acceptable value (even if those already have caused runtime error).

### Release Notes

<details>

### [`v6.0.2`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​602-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribcopy-webpack-plugincomparev601v602-2020-06-03)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v6.0.1...v6.0.2)

### [`v6.0.1`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​601-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribcopy-webpack-plugincomparev600v601-2020-05-16)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v6.0.0...v6.0.1)

### [`v6.0.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​600-httpsgithubcomwebpack-contribcopy-webpack-plugincomparev511v600-2020-05-15)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/compare/v5.1.1...v6.0.0)

##### ‚ö† BREAKING CHANGES

-   minimum supported Node.js version is `10.13`, 
-   the plugin now accepts an object, you should change `new CopyPlugin(patterns, options)` to `new CopyPlugin({ patterns, options })`
-   migrate on `compilation.additionalAssets` hook
-   the `ignore` option was removed in favor `globOptions.ignore`
-   the `test` option was removed in favor the `transformPath` option
-   the `cache` option was renamed to the `cacheTransform` option, `cacheTransform` option should have only `directory` and `keys` properties when it is an object
-   global `context` and `ignore` options were removed in favor `patten.context` and `pattern.globOptions.ignore` options
-   the missing file error is now an error, before it was a warning
-   the `from` option now can only be a string, if you use `{ from: { glob: 'directory/**', dot: false } }` changed it to `{ from: 'directory/**', globOptions: { dot: false } }`
-   the `copyUnmodified` was removed without replacements
-   the `2` version of `webpack-dev-server` is not supported anymore
-   the `logLevel` was removed in favor the `infrastructureLogging.level` option, please read the [documentation](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/other-options/#infrastructurelogginglevel)

##### Features

-   implement the `concurrency` option ([#​466](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/466)) ([c176d7d](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/c176d7d124cf3c5ad372576d4b0f7fbf5e1d0afc))

-   implement the `noErrorOnMissing` option ([#​475](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/475)) ([e3803ce](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/e3803ceffe93361184efc9b799be4c9dfb4eb467))
-   migrate on webpack built-in logger ([#​446](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/issues/446)) ([5af02bc](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/copy-webpack-plugin/commit/5af02bcfc716b6bca96b569740a45221a974ae61))

##### Bug Fixes

Issues.Title: Paths decalred in compilerOptions tsconfig.app.json not working
Issues.Body:
I have already seen some issues related with this topic here but any one can fix my issue..

CONTEXT OF THE ISSUE:
It is curios i have similar setup in other project and it is working perfect. As context of how i got on this, I'm trying to do a merge between ASP .Net Boilerplate but replaing the front with ngx-admin.

Original project uses only main tsconfig.json file in source. Ngx-admin uses tsconfig.json main folder and tsconfig.app.json and tsconfig.spec.json in src folder. As well as tsconfig.e2e.json in e2e folder.
All was perfect until i started merging this files.

So, I created and attached a smaill brand new repro project: 

STEPS TO DUPLICATE
1. Download the attached project
2. Run npm install
3. Open src/AppPreBootstrap.ts file
4. BUG: You will see that the import to AppConsts class does not work as @shared/AppConsts is not recognized.
5. BUG: Try to retype @sha  and intellisense does not bring the option to add @shared........
6. Optionally you can run ng serve, But in this project this issue does not affect the compilation but warning about classes not used.
[DuplicateTsConfigissue.zip](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/files/4739674/DuplicateTsConfigissue.zip)
![ErrorTSCONFIG](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57273906/83940078-86226700-a7a7-11ea-93fd-d0706e136cb5.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Paths decalred in compilerOptions tsconfig.app.json not working" (#17873)

Issues.Title: add option to disable concatenateModules when build
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
my project build is too slow (in my computer it may 300 - 400s, but in bit bucket pipeline it may took 15 minute), so i try to find way to speed up.

i found that most of time use in  ModuleConcatenationPlugin. so i just curious if i disable ModuleConcatenationPlugin can improve build speed up. so i edit `node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\angular-cli-files\models\webpack-configs\common.js` and add `concatenateModules: false,` to `optimization` section. 

this is my test result when build 3 times.  it improve speed around 30-50%. and it has same number of chunk (at least total *.js is equals 
ModuleConcatenationPlugin | total *.js | time 1 | time 2 | time 3 | Avg (ms)
-- | -- |-- | -- | -- | --
enable | 153 | 326157 | 304320 | 329917 | 320131.3
disable | 153 | 214214 | 137226 | 129218 | 160219.3

and this is when i build on Google Cloud Build (because it slower than my PC) .as you can see it reduce time from 13 min to around 7 min. 
ModuleConcatenationPlugin | time 1 | time 2 | time 3 | Avg (ms)
-- | -- | -- | -- | --
enable | 789887 | 770099 | 690083 | 750023
disable | 434142 | 308942 | 307106 | 350063.3


downside of disable ModuleConcatenationPlugin  it may increase bundle size. this is my project size. (from du -bcs )
Category | enable | disable | diff (bytes)
--------- | ------- | ------- | ----
*.js | 27342921 | 27547828 | 204907 
\*es5\*.js | 14036712 | 14139111 |  102399
\*es2015\*.js | 13272068 | 13374576 | 102508

i am not sure but i think angular should not need ModuleConcatenationPlugin since angular handle chunk by lazy route module. i am not sure angular can get benefit from ModuleConcatenationPlugin? or may be i just misunderstand something? 

### Describe the solution you'd like
it would be nice if add option to disable concatenateModules in angular.json or build command


### Describe alternatives you've considered
just run this command before build to disable concatenateModules 
```
sed -i "s/noEmitOnErrors: true,$/noEmitOnErrors: true,concatenateModules: false,/" "node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/common.js"
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "add option to disable concatenateModules when build" (#17874)

Issues.Title: build: use rimraf instead of custom rimraf
Issues.Body: With this change we replace the custom rimraf implementation in the build script with the rimraf npm package. The main reason for this change is because `dist` can be a symlink when building with bazel but our implementation doesn't that.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: use rimraf instead of custom rimraf" (#17865)

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): improve eliding in constructor parameter transform
Issues.Body:
This change allows TypeScript to directly elide unused imports that were also used to reference constructor parameter metadata.  Previously the plugin's import elider was necessary to remove these imports.

This is meant as a proof of concept for an alternative import eliding prevention technique.

Issues.Title: [WDS] Disconnected! net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package I don't know where the problem may be. ### Is this a regression? No. ### Description Hi, it took a few months to debug the adb in android gives me problems. I connect the device, accept the debugging authorization and every 20 minutes it disconnects alone, thus popping up again to accept authorization. I debug the apps with livereload, I use the ionic 4 framework. Does anyone know why that happens? Some time ago this was working correctly but I don't know if it's an adb problem or not. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I use the Ionic Framework with version 4, but this happens to me with any version, 1. I connect my device to the PC. 2. I accept the authorization of debugging. 3. I check with the adb devices command that my device recognizes. 4. You recognize it. 5. I launch my application with the command: ionic cordova run android --livereload --consolelogs. 6. I open the chrome bug to debug my app and see the logs. 7. When 20 minutes have passed, the authorization popup reappears on the device and I get the following error in the DevTools console ## üî• Exception or Error 

[WDS] Disconnected!
close @ vendor.js:137905


Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED
sockjs-node/info?t=1590993683214
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Ionic:
   Ionic CLI                     : 5.4.9 (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/ionic)
   Ionic Framework               : @ionic/angular 5.1.1
   @angular-devkit/build-angular : 0.803.26
   @angular-devkit/schematics    : 8.3.26
   @angular/cli                  : 8.3.26
   @ionic/angular-toolkit        : 2.2.0

Cordova:

   Cordova CLI       : 9.0.0 (cordova-lib@9.0.1)
   Cordova Platforms : android 8.1.0
   Cordova Plugins   : cordova-plugin-ionic-keyboard 2.2.0, cordova-plugin-ionic-webview 4.2.1, (and 13 other plugins)

Utility:

   cordova-res : 0.11.0 (update available: 0.14.0)
   native-run  : 0.2.9 (update available: 1.0.0)

System:

   Android SDK Tools : 26.1.1 (/Users/achacon/Library/Android/sdk)
   ios-deploy        : 1.10.0
   ios-sim           : 8.0.2
   NodeJS            : v10.16.3 (/usr/local/bin/node)
   npm               : 6.13.6
   OS                : macOS Catalina
   Xcode             : Xcode 11.4.1 Build version 11E503a
**Anything else relevant?** I suspect it must be an error from @ angular-devkit or the chrome browser, because I have searched the ADB forums and it does not look like an error, since there are many people who experience this and others who do not.

Issues.Title: refactor: assert value for RxJS v7 compatibility
Issues.Body:
In RxJS v7, the type of `Subject.next()` will change from `next(value?: T)` to `next(value: T)` ([change](https://github.com/ReactiveX/rxjs/commit/33561526d2c893fdb2a7c5552a3c86806cb0e9a9#diff-54b18fdea0a03178c258be326d16f566L61)). No runtime behavior is affected, but this change will break users who build from source. This PR corrects types to ensure projects build successfully.

### Changes
- asserts `T|undefined|null` values to `T` where appropriate.
- refactor instances of `Subject<any>` to `Subject<void>` so the `next()` method can be called without passing an argument.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: assert value for RxJS v7 compatibility" (#19569)

Issues.Title: refactor(list): use light-weight tokens for injecting parent lists
Issues.Body:
Angular Material list items currently optionally inject a parent `MatNavList`
or `MatList`. This has the downside of retaining these tokens at runtime
because they are used for dependency injection as values.

We can improve this by using so-called light-weight tokens. These allow
us to continue injecting parent list or nav-lists, but without the risk of
retaining the `MatList` and `MatNavList` classes with their factories.

This was already the case before Angular v9 with View Engine, but
the problem became significantly **worse** with Ivy, where factories are now
directly attached to the classes (such as `MatList` or `MatNavList`).

Using light-weight tokens avoids this issue and gives us an additional
size improvement. Notably this won't be an improvement when an
application uses both the nav-list and standard `MatList`.

Related to angular/angular-cli#16866. More context on light-weight tokens in:
https://hackmd.io/@mhevery/SyqDjUlrU#.

**Note**: I'll be going through other components in the repo and send
similar changes (if applicable; and non-breaking).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(list): use light-weight tokens for injecting parent lists " (#19568)

Issues.Body:
Executing tests on MacOS Catalina runs into issues with bazel 3.0.0.
Bazel will use the version specified in the .bazelversion file and hence

d4d12a95 changed WORKSPACE and .bazelversion from 3.1.0 to 3.0.0 which

Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

currently EventListenerFocusTrapInertStrategy only base on "div.cdk-overlay-pane" to detect the focus is inside overlay. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691013/84007002-45db0880-a9a2-11ea-8c4e-531a5115fa0f.png)
but it is not enough when we using third party plugin or our own overlay.

#### Use Case
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691013/84007208-9ce0dd80-a9a2-11ea-84d6-4d18c06af698.gif)
for example using @tinymce/tinymce-angular
it not depend on angular/cdk, so there is no overlay. but it have own implement overlay feature.

for workaround we can totally override a strategy for the case. but maybe angular team can consider add a easy way for that.

Issues.Title: bug(MatInputHarness): error setting decimal value on input with type="number"
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a matInput with type="number" and step="0.01"
2. Get MatInputHarness for the input and attempt to set a decimal value on it, e.g.

```ts
await input.setValue('22.45');
```
 
#### Expected Behavior

The value is set to 22.45

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

Chrome gives the error `The specified value "22." is not a valid number. The value must match to the following regular expression: -?(\d+|\d+\.\d+|\.\d+)([eE][-+]?\d+)?`

The actual set value is only the decimal part of the number, i.e. `45`.

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.9
- CDK/Material: 9.2.4
- Browser(s): Chrome 80.0.3987.149
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS 10.15.5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatInputHarness): error setting decimal value on input with type="number"" (#19561)

Issues.Title: docs(a11y): add note about cdkFocusInitial inside focus trap directive
Issues.Body:
Adds a note to the docs mentioning that `cdkFocusInitial` won't do anything inside the focus trap directive, unless `cdkTrapFocusAutoCapture` is enabled.

Fixes #19475.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs(a11y): add note about cdkFocusInitial inside focus trap directive" (#19560)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): allow handle to be set on drag element if there is a different drag root
Issues.Body:
Currently we only allow the drag handle to be a descendant of the drag element, but this can be inconvenient if the drag root is moved further up the DOM using `cdkDragRootElement`. These changes allow for a handle to be set on the drag element itself, if it has an alternate drag root.

Fixes #19555.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): allow handle to be set on drag element if there is a different drag root" (#19559)

Issues.Title: MatFormField: Changing appearance is not reflected in the view.
Issues.Body:
**Reproduction**
Steps to reproduce:

1. Define a mat-form-field:
My own: 
```
<mat-form-field appearance="{{data.appearance}}">
        <mat-label>Some label</mat-label>
        <input #inputElement matInput type="text"/>
 </mat-form-field>
```
2. Change the appearance:
`update() { this.data.appearance = 'outline'; //was 'standard' before  }` 
or
    `@ViewChild(MatFormField) matFormField: MatFormField;`
``update() {
this.matFormField.appearance = 'outline';  //was 'standard' before
}``

**Expected Behavior**
It should change the appearance of the `<mat-form-field>` .

**Actual Behavior**
There is no visual effect in either of the 2 approaches.
|
|
|
 `ChangeDetectionStrategy` is set to default for my component. I am using Angular 9 and "@angular/material": "^8.1.3"
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MatFormField: Changing appearance is not reflected in the view." (#19556)

Issues.Title: build: don't flag noop mixins in theme mixin rule
Issues.Body: The `theme-mixin-api` rule flags any mixin that doesn't include a variable that extracts the config. This can be annoying for noop placeholder mixins since we have to declare a variable that won't be used. These changes add an exception for mixins that are empty or only contain comment nodes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: don't flag noop mixins in theme mixin rule" (#19558)

Issues.Title: feat(material-experimental): add MDC-based mat-option and mdc-core entry point
Issues.Body:
- Sets up the MDC-based `mat-option` and `mat-optgroup` which are a prerequisite for the MDC-based `mat-select` and `mat-autocomplete`.
- Adds a new `mdc-core` entry point which is the equivalent of `material/core`. We'll need this in the future for other things like an MDC-based `mat-core-theme` and for the elevation styles.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material-experimental): add MDC-based mat-option and mdc-core entry point" (#19557)

Issues.Title: bug(drag-drop): cdk-overlay-pane is not scrollable
Issues.Body:
To reproduce this issue we need to create a material dialog and make it draggable using cdkDrag directive and cdkDragRootElement=".cdk-overlay-pane" applied to the dialog's header.
Therefore in mobile devices we are not able to scroll dialog's content

StackBlitz with the issue - https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-nyrwmp

This issue only appears in 9.0.0+ versions.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Just drag dialog clicking header

#### Actual Behavior

Now we are dragging dialog by touching anywhere in the dialog, even by inputs touching

#### Environment

- Angular: v9+
- CDK/Material: v9+ 
- Browser(s): Google Chrome Version 83.0.4103.61 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Android 7.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(drag-drop): cdk-overlay-pane is not scrollable" (#19555)

Issues.Title: Pagination controls for mat-tab-group do not appear when used with the mat-sidenav
Issues.Body:
I am trying to use the mat-sidenav with the mat-tab-group and there appears to be an issue with the pagination controls for the mat-tab-group. The test app will create 3 default tabs. If you add enough tabs so that there is just enough space to show the tabs without the tab pagination controls being displayed (based on your screen width), then open the sidenav by clicking the Toggle Sidenav button, the pagination controls do not appear in the tab control. Clicking the Add Tab button to add one more tab will force the tab control to reevaluate the horizontal space and then display the pagination controls for the tab control. It appears that that the tab control is not aware that the horizontal space has decreased, because the sidenav is open, and does not show the pagination controls. The opposite is also true that if the pagination controls are displayed when the sidenav is open, when the sidenav is closed and there is enough horizontal space that the tab control no longer needs the pagination controls they do not disappear. The desired behavior would be that the tab control will display or not display its pagination controls when necessary as the sidenav is open and closed. ```

Sidenav
Tab content for {{tab.label}}
``` ``` import { Component } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.css'] }) export class AppComponent { tabs: any[] = [{label: "tab1"}, {label: "tab2"}, {label: "tab3"}] addTab() { this.tabs.push({label: "tab" + (this.tabs.length + 1)}) } } ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Pagination controls for mat-tab-group do not appear when used with the mat-sidenav" (#19562)

Issues.Title: fix(focus indicators): Improve styles that determine when focus indicators should render on selection controls.
Issues.Body:
For accessibility reasons, it's usually a bad idea to nest interactive elements such as buttons, additional selection controls, form fields, etc inside of Material's selection controls 
(i.e. checkbox, radio, slide toggle). In practice, it's done quite often because it's an easy way to visually align content with the selection controls' labels.

Our previous styles were set up such that if the selection control was focused, all of the focus indicators nested within that selection control would render. Instead, only the focus indicator associated with the particular selection control should be rendered. These new styles do that.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(focus indicators): Improve styles that determine when focus indicators should render on selection controls." (#19546)

Issues.Title: bug(workspace): We need to deduplicate browsers in our WORKSPACE
Issues.Body:
### Context
The bug is being knowingly introduced here in PR #19320. We are loading another version of chromium in the repository from `dev-infra`. We plan on using the browsers loaded from `dev-infra` as that one has RBE improvements. This is an issue to make sure we remember to deduplicate the browsers once that PR is merged in.

Paraphrasing @devversion, this change has the potential of speeding up local dev. Right now browser archives are extracted frequently due to bad caching.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(workspace): We need to deduplicate browsers in our WORKSPACE" (#19543)
